page.title: 03A unique industry
page.content: In a corner of{Ridgeway}village is the firm of{T.&J.Hutton & Co. Ltd.}the only remaining{sickle factory}in the country. Originally sited at Birley Hay, Ford, the Huttons moved to the{ {Phoenix}works in Ridgeway in{1822 The managing director is{Mr. Peter {Clegg}nephew of Gilbert Hutton. 19 local people are employed making scythes and sickles stamped with the trademark{"B Y"}("Best Yet"), combining tradition with modern technology. The stainless and carbon{steel}comes from{England, France and Italy; wood} for the handles from{Finland. About 4000 sickles are made each week, most being exported to{South {Africa, Ethiopia,Sri Lanka}etc., where they are used for cutting{rice, maize {and seaweed.}About 200 scythes are made each week,some for export.
